Miasma is useless. At least, when I played her last it felt like that. Small aoe, negligible damage per tick, slow does not feel significant, very small aoe... it's biggest use for me was the free vision - Q does everything W does and does it better.

If I may suggest some potential thoughts, RiotRepertoir, I'd like to reexplore the identity of Cass. Who does Riot think her to be? Who does Riot want her to be? 

Cass is Kat's sister but she is not the same. She is not an assassin with extreme burst & mobility. She is almost an antithesis of Kat, in mage form. Yet the current hypercarry 500+ stack kit is basically making her do extreme burst. That shouldn't happen. Cass is not a sword, she is a sweet poison. Not sharp or pointy but a corrosive acid. Her gameplay, her essence is subtle, gradual, and ultimately terrifying. She is not a femme fatale, but rather a siren slowing singing sailors beneath the sorry, salty seas, smiling all the while. 

To me, killing is just a job for Kat. She enjoys the the action, sure - the thrill, the chase, the dancing with knives only to escape like a legend. But it's just the family trade, she is the eldest Noxian and her father's legacy. Yet Cass chose what she became; she had another available path and she didn't take it. Suffering is her life. It is her pleasure, her goal. After her tragic disfigurement due to a broken oath over a strangely serpentine sword - no offense, but her role in the new Shurima lore feels to me like bullshit - she has become the seductress, the schemer, the secretress. 

So let's make a kit that reflects that. Right now Cass feels like a mage Nasus. You just wait for stacks - passive - and then spam low cd abilities - namely e. That is the game play. Her ult feels out of place too, both with her identity and kit due to the unreliable nature of the stun and its relatively long cooldown. Her e is so broken - restores mana on kill, increases poison damage, spell vamps, -  whereas her w is meaningless. 

Cass deserves a kit which does not boast of immediate power at any point of the game, but rather of assured reliability. I don't mean technically; I mean such that her damage does not depend on a time-based/confrontational passive (which isn't even her style). Maybe this isn't making sense; if so, I apologize. I just want to get all of my thoughts down and open so I can better articulate what is in my head.

I really like the comparison to singed. I don't think his kit should be copied, but the uniqueness of his gameplay - the way he broke the meta, completely flouted conventions to pursue his own goals and have confidence in them, was so refreshing, so satisfying, and _Singed_. Cass merits a similar unique identity (hell, all the champs really should, so please stop with the three stack passives and &health true damage). When you play Kat her identity is clear and transparent and so damn godlike when you execute her skills with the mastery she worked so damn hard to obtain. An expert assassin with a very hypercarry feel on an ult reset. You are rewarding players for doing what Kat should and punishing them when they don't do it well. We should ensure the same happens to Cass in regards to satisfaction and association with her identity and gameplay.

But it is easy for me to talk and very hard to actually construct a kit. I recognize this and I apologize if it seems I am un-understanding.
Allow me to point out what to me are flaws in her current kit:

-Ridiculously bad passive
It needs to be under her control, not some time-based aspect which seems so randomly created. Furthermore, constant confrontation doesn't seem her style, but more like Kat's. When a viper strikes, it strikes once. And then slithers away confident in its prey's demise. Snakes, scorpions, and spiders share those scheming qualities - let the passive reflect it.
I have no ideas about thsi right now, but I'm sure something will come up. Maybe something with shedding skins - something like Anivia egg except different. When she has lost say more than 70% of her health, she can channel for a few seconds and "shed a skin". All it does is restore some health - dependent on her bonus health - and restore all amor/magic resist values, removing any defensive debuffs.
There is obviously some sort of internal cooldown and can be broken by cc - she can't use it in combat, and if she uses it in lane she will lose some time/control. But it gives her a way to compete with harass/sustain as an immobile DoT mage.

-Actually a great Q
I really like how Q is right now. I think it does just what it should - low cd, scaling DoT, and gives ms on champion hit. The last part is great and huge - offers utility that is indirect, by which I mean flexible. Can be used for either offense or defense. Really like it rght now.

- A "near subpar ability to Q" W
This offers nothing except free vision and a slow which is just not significant enough. I propose Miasma to have a larger radius, time-scaling damage damage, lasts longer, larger cd, much more significant mana cost and with some sort of utility effect that feels utterly useless in the first two seconds but is devastating after 5 or 6. Devastating in light of her other abilities.
Perhaps, it releases a poison gas cloud which first slows then blinds then briefly knocks down. Or perhaps it melts magic resist with a debuff whose duration and severity depend on how long the targets stood in miasma, with both getting worse and getting worse _worser_ every second the targets remain in Miasma. Regardless, its like a Malzahar W except the damage is not constant over time but heavily skewed depending on time, and comes with a utility effect that seems insignificant at 1/2 s but can only be ignored at one's peril 4 or 5 seconds in.
Also, larger CD to ensure Cass uses it well and positions appropriately. Move the free vision to Q.

-Currently Obscenely Broken E
You gotta scrap this mate. At least, the current spamming aspect to it. I'ts just not her. She is not a Ryze to faceroll the keys.
I love the fact it restores mana (on kill) and enhances poison damage. But maybe, E is like a "mark" ability. She can choose monster/champion to mark, which causes all poison damage to deal additional X% of itself as %health true damage. I like this ability having both a passive and active - with the passive giving slight mana regen buff on minion/monster kill, perhaps a significant damage evasion buff on champ kill. Nothing on assist - Cass is a proud woman; she likes to be the one her victims think of last, and the only one. The mark ability is NOT fixed, but free to shift but it has a price. Damage she takes from the target gives her a taste of her own medicine and it burns her health too.

- Really Out of Place R
It doesn't feel right to me. Perhaps, I am in the minority here, but I don't think she deserves any hard CC on her ult like that. Her ult is too Medusa/Ekans Paralyze mode. It should be distinct from Ahri and her charm as well. Perhaps, it should be like a seductive, secretive, smiling, singing siren. Its obvious I like that image, but I think it befits her style. And her ult should equally awe and terror inducing, beauty on the outside and unimaginable horror and pain on the inside.

Hopefully, this is helpful. I'm trying to give some of my insights and i'd love to continue this conversation further if it would be of use to you.

If she's going to scale and remain a Hypercarry type champ, her W can't really be utility.

But you guys can be tricky, and make an ability a damage threat that feels appropriate.

Example Miasma:

Cassiopeia launches a Miasma at a target location for 7s granting vision. The Miasma slows units, applies Grevious wounds, and grows in size over time. 

The first enemy champion effected, that is not already infected, is infected by the Miasma refreshing it's duration, causing it to follow the infected champion, and affecting enemy units in it's radius (think Zilean bomb, but a poison cloud). 

Enemy champions affected by the Miasma take damage whenever they deal damage/are dealt damage/Use an ability/attack/are attacked/move x units/insert some other triggering effect that I missed (not all effects need to be used, just providing examples of possible triggers) If the infected enemy dies before the duration of the Miasma ends, their Miasma disappears.

I think a mixture of visions is needed in order to move on. A hyper-scaling DoT mage that is target agnostic, and not much of a lane bully in the early levels, but scales well with time (if that makes sense) acting as sort of a Mage Nasus. A rage timer that really can take over a game if not shut down. All while primarily using Damage over Time effects as their lethal interaction with enemy champions. 

But something needs to happen soon, like before the Immoble mage update timeframe, because she's not doing well at all. People can point to her in the LCS, but I could point to Taric in the LCS, it doesn't mean he's a reasonable pick.

I feel like they should provide a mixture of damage and utility--but different types of utility. They should both provide damage, but they should serve different situations better (or somehow make one help in setting up the other).

I personally like the idea of making Cass's poisons "ramp up" somehow, in a way that isn't primarily dependent on Twin Fang. Maybe a stacking mechanic, where Q applies both a stronger "short-term poison" and a longer-lasting, stackable poison debuff (that W stacks faster and Q/E can refresh)?

I alternatively like the idea of making Cass use different options based on how close she is to killing her prey.

Q needs a MAJOR damage increase. Right now trading with any other mage isn't worth it as cass, and landing a well placed and timed Q does little to nothing in the fight without at least 2 E's which is REALLY lame. 

I love cass she was the first ever mage to make me play her constantly i think i played her 40+ times in a row. I even got to the stage where i would leave a champ select if i didn't get mid... and i never use to do that. Now she is one of the least viable mages to go mid and that is really sad...

It seems like a lot of people don't really like the intense emphasis on Twin Fang for DPS, although I'm not sure if it would be appropriate to just remove it altogether. Perhaps using it as a "poison enhancer" of sorts would help scratch that "poison mage" itch, perhaps extending the poison's duration and granting stacking bonus effects depending on what they're afflicted by (ex. TF on Q poison could lower enemy MR, TF on W poison could reduce attackspeed, etc.)

Q should be her core poke/harass tool. The bread and butter of her kit.

W should be zone control/denial. It should serve to severely limit her enemies' options. (either by very powerful cc or strong damage. basicaly make them actively **want** to *avoid* it)

E should be her "side arm." This is the weapon she brings out when going for the kill on a low hp target or drawn as her last line of defense(when she gets dived). It should be strong, but not her go to weapon of choice for all of her damage.

R should be her clutch move. The thing you whip out to turn the tides of battle(just like sona ult before the mobility creep had fully sunken in)

Hope that helps. If you want, I could go into further detail if you think it's needed.

>
> To clarify, does that mean you would like both her Q and her W to serve the same purpose? Or you would like one to act as damage and the other as utility?

I like when a champion's spells are distinct and I'm sure there are plenty of ways for W to be a better zoning tool than it currently is without dealing a lot of damage. Although a champion like Cass would pretty much always need to skill up abilities based on how she gets the most damage out of them, so if there were to be intended variety in leveling order her damage budget would need to be split relatively evenly between them.

Actually, if W was intended to be a big source of her damage, then it would need to be skilled up relatively early on to stay relevant, which probably isn't going to happen given its longer cooldown. No matter what it's probably going to be a one-and-done ability until very late game and would then probably only work if the damage was low and the utility was high.

Cassiopeia should be reworked with mechanics that support her theme and lore; poison and deception. 

Poison should be integral to her kit, and perhaps her skills could revolve around using a combination of debilitating effects (health drain, slow, blindness, silence etc) in order to cut out her victim's options before killing them. Cass isn't supposed to be a hyper-mobile assassin but rather a cruel death-dealer who revels in taking advantage over her opponent when they least expect it. 

There's a lot of potential for Cass for administer different _kinds_ of poisons in her kit and have them interact different depending on the combination that she uses. Taking a bit of real-world inspiration here; there are well known variants of venom across different species of snakes (neurotoxins and cytotoxins for example) and it would be interesting to see those translated into gameplay mechanics.
Cass' R feels really unhelpful most of the time because it's completely reliant on enemies facing her. Either buff it or scrap it for something else.

Unpopular opinion time!

I actually like this new passive more than the old passive. But before you start downvoting know this: I'm not saying that her new passive is *good* i'm saying it's *better.*

Allow me to explain:

Old passive: Spam spells and run out of mana in order to slightly reduce her mana costs (Which won't matter because you're already out of mana.) [This has the unfortunate side effect of forcing people playing Cassiopeia to stack mana regen, which gets nerfed.]

New passive: Keep things poisoned and build up some stacks in order to gain a big buff if you can keep your farm going.

To me, her new passive is an *improvement* but I can agree on it being an annoying gateway on her power, and I would be happy to have a new, new passive. But please: Not the old one.

Personally, I like her current QWE. It gives me a clear focus on how to do damage with her kit: Keep someone poisoned and then light them up with E, reapply poison as needed. (Perhaps we could even make E reapply poison?)

However, as some other people have posted, her R doesn't make a lot of sense aside from "SEE GUYS IT'S MEDUSA THE GORGON STONE STATUES GREEK MYTHOLOGY GET IT?!?!?!"

What I'd enjoy seeing would be a new ult that allows her to cycle through extra poison effects:

Neurotoxin: Increases Cassiopeia's DOT damage duration.

Hemotoxin: Does extra damage based upon target's maximum health.

Dendrotoxin: Slows the target while they are taking poison damage.


But I'm just thinking out loud here, I'd love to hear feedback.

I don't understand how people can complain about her damage being low at ANY point in the game, including early game... I recently played her as _support_ and was easily out damaging carries (on both teams) in both burst and sustain, despite them having more gold and me getting both sightstone and FQC for appropriate support utility.

It wasn't a very long game and I managed to hit max stacks on both her passive and archangel's/seraph's which just made me do EVEN MORE DAMAGE. I wasn't catching up to others in damage, I was blowing them away. I get that people don't like her passive and I agree it doesn't really 'make sense' (though that's honestly true of MANY passives in League) but calling it a 'gate' is just bs. I know the OP in this particular thread didn't call it that explicitly but they did imply it strongly. To me it felt like a reward I worked for.

I love her R thematically so part of me doesn't want to see it changed but I agree it doesn't really play that interestingly with the rest of the kit. It fits the "hyper carry" style somewhat by helping her punish people if they try to engage on her but lots of potential abilities could easily do that as well. I worry that half the people who play her would hate to see it go and half would love to see it go.

Semi related to Cass... I really feel that TotG/Archangel's should be changed to only work by hitting things with abilities, not simply on cast. That would of course require lowering the number of stacks a bit and increasing the mana per stack to balance things out. I think it's worth rewarding people for actually interacting with stuff and not incentivizing them to cast spells just for stacks at the fountain and while just walking places. I also feel that it should reach max stacks slightly faster than it does now, though that may need to accompany a small ryze nerf.
